meanings.definition: To politely refuse or reject something.
meanings.sent1: She declines the offer to go out tonight.
meanings.sent2: He always declines dessert at the end of the meal.
meanings.sent3: The cat declines the invitation to play with the new toy.
meanings.sent4: The student declines the extra credit opportunity, much to the surprise of the teacher.
meanings.sent5: The old man declines the kind offer with a gentle smile.

meanings.definition: To decrease in quantity or quality.
meanings.sent1: The number of visitors to the museum declines during the winter months.
meanings.sent2: The quality of the product declines after multiple uses.
meanings.sent3: The flowers in the garden decline in beauty as the season changes.
meanings.sent4: Her health declines rapidly after she stops following the doctor's advice.
meanings.sent5: The team's performance declines as the game progresses.

meanings.definition: A gradual downward slope or decrease in value or importance.
meanings.sent1: The decline of the ancient ruins is a result of neglect over the years.
meanings.sent2: The economic decline of the town led to many businesses closing down.
meanings.sent3: The decline in popularity of the band was unexpected by their fans.
meanings.sent4: The decline in the stock market caused panic among investors.
meanings.sent5: The decline of the old building symbolized the changing times.
